item.title: Galois Field
item.description: Summary 1 For a prime number $p$ and a natural number $n$, a finite field with cardinality $p^{n}$ is defined as the Galois Field of order $p^{n}$, denoted as $\text{GF} \left( p^{n} \right)$. Finite fields are exclusively Galois Fields, and for a given $p$ and $n$, the Galois Field is uniquely determined.
